page.title: 12 A GRETTON FACTORY
page.content: There is one factory in Gretton, owned by a Mr.Tibbert and Mr.Woolley. It goes under the name of T.W.Electrics and manufactures control panels which switch on generators should the mains electricity fail. The firm started when an Arab businessman asked Mr.Tibbert to make a control panel for him - which was done at home. He was so pleased with it that he wanted more. Special premises were required, and were found at the now disused Gretton Station. Business grew, with control panels being exported to many parts of the world, mainly to oil producing countries. In the late 1970's, a clothing factory in the village closed down and the premises became vacant. This was ideal for Messrs. Tibbert and Woolley and they have occupied them ever since.
